S.FORM: sunis na kebalan aiku.
sonis na kebalan aiko.
S.TRANSL: 我是噶瑪蘭族的小孩。
I am an kebalan child.

S.FORM: yau ta pateRungan leppaw niaq.
yao ta pateRongan leppaw niaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在新社。
Our family lives in pateRungan.

S.FORM: kinlima aimi meniz saleppawan.
kinlima aimi meniz saleppawan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: kintulu aimi nansuani.
kintolo aimi nansoani.
S.TRANSL: 我們有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: aiku seRay tama, tina, Runanay ay qaqa, tazungan ay qaqa matapun qemizuan.
aiko seRay tama, tina, Ronanay ay qaqa, tazongan ay qaqa matapon qemizoan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ibabaw tama ku, tayzin tama ku.
ibabaw tama ko, tayzin tama ko.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: qiwat tina ku, ising tina ku.
qiwat tina ko, ising tina ko.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: tama ku ta leppawan temankebalan timaimian.
tama ko ta leppawan temankebalan timaimian.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Kebalan language with us at home.

S.FORM: hibangan niz imi temanan sa damu.
hibangan niz imi temanan sa damo.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: aiku seRay qanqaqa ku masulun imi qemapaR tu biyat.
aiko seRay qanqaqa ko masolon imi qemapaR to biyat.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊們會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: melizaq iku tu pinileppaw niaq.
melizaq iko to pinileppaw niaq.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: ta hibangan deddan zau, aiku seRay tazungan ay qaqa ku matiw sa taitung melaut tu tama ku.
ta hibangan deddan zao, aiko seRay tazongan ay qaqa ko matiw sa taitong melaot to tama ko.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: maqezi imi ta taipakan mezaqis tu gasuling matiw sa taitung.
maqezi imi ta taipakan mezaqis to gasoling matiw sa taitong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: maseq tu taitung, pasaqay tu qitun tama ku mawtu ta teqezan na qitun semuna timaimian.
maseq to taitong, pasaqay to qiton tama ko mawto ta teqezan na qiton semona timaimian.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: leppaw na tama ku mai medaud tu teqezan na qitun, pasaqay tu qitun kikiyama maseq ti.
leppaw na tama ko mai medaod to teqezan na qiton, pasaqay to qiton kikiyama maseq ti.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: mezaki tu Raya ay qizunan paRama ya leppaw na tama, masulun imi qazitinsia matiw ta paRaman.
mezaki to Raya ay qizonan paRama ya leppaw na tama, masolon imi qazitinsia matiw ta paRaman.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ta paRaman, azasan na imi na tama ku paqan tu sizi seRay mezaqis tu qebayu.
ta paRaman, azasan na imi na tama ko paqan to sizi seRay mezaqis to qebayo.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: qaRabi na, masulun imi matiw ta mazemunan qemizuan lazat qeman.
qaRabi na, masolon imi matiw ta mazemonan qemizoan lazat qeman.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: muwaza qitun na ta mazemunan qemizuan lazat, Raqana qautubay imi matiw tayan.
mowaza qiton na ta mazemonan qemizoan lazat, Raqana qaotobay imi matiw tayan.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ngid imi qawi nani, qawka mesuppaR maRuzik ti utubay niaq, mezaqis ti imi tu basu wi.
ngid imi qawi nani, qawka mesoppaR maRozik ti otobay niaq, mezaqis ti imi to baso wi.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，才發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tangi temanan maseq ti imi tu taipak, Raynguan niaq makala ti uu qemuni ya utubay na ni tama.
tangi temanan maseq ti imi to taipak, Rayngoan niaq makala ti oo qemoni ya otobay na ni tama.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: kiya pama yau imi ta pateRungan qemizuan, temaqsi nani, matalin ti sa sulin, yau ti ta tukayan qemizuan.
kiya pama yao imi ta pateRongan qemizoan, temaqsi nani, matalin ti sa solin, yao ti ta tokayan qemizoan.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在新社，上學以後，就搬到了樹林，一直在都市裡居住。
When we were young, our family lived in pateRungan. After I started school, we moved to Shulin and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: temaqsi ti ta Rayan taqsian nani, sinanam iku tu ussiq sataqsian tu zana yencumin ay, mesuppaR ti ta lawlawan ay yencumin yau naququni ay muwaza wawaway na.
temaqsi ti ta Rayan taqsian nani, sinanam iko to ossiq sataqsian to zana yencomin ay, mesoppaR ti ta lawlawan ay yencomin yao naqoqoni ay mowaza wawaway na.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Raqana, hibangan na tasaw setangi, aiku seRay Runanay ay qaqa temanan sa damu melaut tu baqian, ngid qasuppaR tu naquni ya wawaway na zata.
Raqana, hibangan na tasaw setangi, aiko seRay Ronanay ay qaqa temanan sa damo melaot to baqian, ngid qasoppaR to naqoni ya wawaway na zata.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: uwalu betin ti tasaw na baqian, wanayka taytan ta zau sunis pama.
owalo betin ti tasaw na baqian, wanayka taytan ta zao sonis pama.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: pasanu iku mesuppaR tu utani sikawman, nengi tenankebalan na, suppaR temanbusus qaya, tamankizaya seRay temanzipun.
pasano iko mesoppaR to otani sikawman, nengi tenankebalan na, soppaR temanbosos qaya, tamankizaya seRay temanzipon.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的噶瑪蘭語說得很流利，也會說閩語、阿美語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in kebalan, as well as Hokkien, Pangcah and Japanese.

S.FORM: pasanu iku timazipana qawka mesuppaR, timangu kiya pama sinanam ti tu sikawman na zipun, kizay ya lazat ya napawan na, ta qakelawkawayan na mazemun qenanaman na tu lazat na busus, Raqana mesuppaR aizipna tu muwaza sikawman.

pasano iko timazipana qawka mesoppaR, timango kiya pama sinanam ti to sikawman na zipon, kizay ya lazat ya napawan na, ta qakelawkawayan na mazemon qenanaman na to lazat na bosos, Raqana mesoppaR aizipna to mowaza sikawman.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是阿美族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pangcah, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: ta nipasanuan niaq nani, semanu ya baqian tu muwaza qenasuppaR na waway na semalaw masang.
ta nipasanoan niaq nani, semano ya baqian to mowaza qenasoppaR na waway na semalaw masang.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: yau muwaza qenaRayngan niaq mipil, wanayka paninguan niaq tu azazasaz ay simaipilan, qanengi muman paqangi mipil.
yao mowaza qenaRayngan niaq mipil, wanayka paningoan niaq to azazasaz ay simaipilan, qanengi moman paqangi mipil.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: kiya pama mai iku mesuppaR tu naquni waway na kebalan, yencumin ya aizipna yau qanasikazan na.
kiya pama mai iko mesoppaR to naqoni waway na kebalan, yencomin ya aizipna yao qanasikazan na.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: muwaza ti qenasuppaRan nani, meRakebalan ay lazat ta aneman na, maken tatezuma, qaRuzangian ay qaya.
mowaza ti qenasoppaRan nani, meRakebalan ay lazat ta aneman na, maken tatezoma, qaRozangian ay qaya.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為噶瑪蘭族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a kebalan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: setangi upitu duki maseq iku ta taqsian.
setangi opito doki maseq iko ta taqsian.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: siangatu ti temaqsi, semuRem ti patudan ta tudan, semanu ti ya pancang," qiRi ka! subat ka!"
siangato ti temaqsi, semoRem ti patodan ta todan, semano ti ya pancang," qiRi ka! sobat ka!"
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Rayan niaq sikawma, "patudan nengi aisu".
Rayan niaq sikawma, "patodan nengi aiso".
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: temaqsi nani, temud patudan timaimi tu sabidangan ay sikawman na kebalan.
temaqsi nani, temod patodan timaimi to sabidangan ay sikawman na kebalan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Kebalan language of numbers.

S.FORM: qeminunung imi tu patudan meliyam, satezay ti imi tu zana sabidang ay satezayan.
qeminonong imi to patodan meliyam, satezay ti imi to zana sabidang ay satezayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: muwaza ti nisinanam niaq tu sikawman na kebalan.
mowaza ti nisinanam niaq to sikawman na kebalan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Kebalan languages.

S.FORM: pitemawaR iku temaqsi, pitemawaR iku sinanam tu sikawman na kebalan, tankebalan pa iku tu tina paipil.
pitemawaR iko temaqsi, pitemawaR iko sinanam to sikawman na kebalan, tankebalan pa iko to tina paipil.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Kebalan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ti utay nangan ku.
ti otay nangan ko.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是utay。
My name is utay.

S.FORM: ti asing nangan na tama ku.
ti asing nangan na tama ko.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是asing。
My dad’s name is asing.

S.FORM: ti ipay nangan na tina ku.
ti ipay nangan na tina ko.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是ipay。
My mother’s name is ipay.

S.FORM: Rabetin ti tasaw ku.
Rabetin ti tasaw ko.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: yau paqenanem qaqa ku, ti buya nangan na, Rabetin yau ussiq ti tasaw na.
yao paqenanem qaqa ko, ti boya nangan na, Rabetin yao ossiq ti tasaw na.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫buya，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is buya, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: masulun imi temaqsi ta taqsian.
masolon imi temaqsi ta taqsian.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: aiku seRay qaqa ku nizu melizaq satezay.
aiko seRay qaqa ko nizo melizaq satezay.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: melizaq iku menanguy, azu yau hibang, matiw imi saleppawan menanguy.
melizaq iko menangoy, azo yao hibang, matiw imi saleppawan menangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: melizaq iku menanam tu tasu ay kaput, nengi imi matapun satezay seRay menanguy.
melizaq iko menanam to taso ay kapot, nengi imi matapon satezay seRay menangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: masulun iku tu tina ku melusit sa tati semaqsaqay.
masolon iko to tina ko melosit sa tati semaqsaqay.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: puli ya deddan, semin qenamammaq na, saRu ya bali.
poli ya deddan, semin qenamammaq na, saRo ya bali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: yau imi ta puRuRan qeman tu minpaw, Raysezang, semin qenamammaq na.
yao imi ta poRoRan qeman to minpaw, Raysezang, semin qenamammaq na.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: qemadanan, RatebaRi ti ya deddan.
qemadanan, RatebaRi ti ya deddan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: mipil iku tu tina ku," manna RatebaRi ti ya deddan?"
mipil iko to tina ko," manna RatebaRi ti ya deddan?"
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: semanu ti ti tina," pasi qayau pa ti banged."
semano ti ti tina," pasi qayao pa ti banged."
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: qaRabi ti, mai tu lanem ta deddanan, mezukat ti buletedan.
qaRabi ti, mai to lanem ta deddanan, mezokat ti boletedan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: tanan ti imi qaya.
tanan ti imi qaya.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: temanan ta lazanan nani, temunuR iku tu buletedan.
temanan ta lazanan nani, temonoR iko to boletedan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: "naRin patuqazan ya banged, ngid pama iku lusit sa tati semaqsaqay."
"naRin patoqazan ya banged, ngid pama iko losit sa tati semaqsaqay."
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: yau ta kinilan na leppaw niaq taqsian ku, pitemawaR iku semaqay matiw, semaqay temanan qaya.
yao ta kinilan na leppaw niaq taqsian ko, pitemawaR iko semaqay matiw, semaqay temanan qaya.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: mai tabay taqsian niaq, mai mazemun pataqsian, simqananam meniz.
mai tabay taqsian niaq, mai mazemon pataqsian, simqananam meniz.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: matapun imi sunsunis meniz ta unduban, mawRat tu mali, sidadak qaya.
matapon imi sonsonis meniz ta ondoban, mawRat to mali, sidadak qaya.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: masulun timaimi mawRawRat patudan niaq, azu saleppawan aimi.
masolon timaimi mawRawRat patodan niaq, azo saleppawan aimi.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: pitemawaR imi seminap, paqangian niaq paqedasaq tudan niaq.
pitemawaR imi seminap, paqangian niaq paqedasaq todan niaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: yau ay semupas tu dengat, yau ay seminap.
yao ay semopas to dengat, yao ay seminap.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: seminap imi qaya tu tuqtuqusan na taqsian, sinapun tu kelawkawayan, pitemawaR dasaq ya taqsian niaq.
seminap imi qaya to toqtoqosan na taqsian, sinapon to kelawkawayan, pitemawaR dasaq ya taqsian niaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: siRab, matiw iku sa damu melaut tu baqi ku.
siRab, matiw iko sa damo melaot to baqi ko.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: tennes ti imi mai simqatazay, sizenges iku timaizipana.
tennes ti imi mai simqatazay, sizenges iko timaizipana.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: taytan na iku na baqi, paqanan na tu pelulu, pananuman na tu ucia.
taytan na iko na baqi, paqanan na to pelolo, pananoman na to ocia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: datebus nipaluman na baqi tu pelulu, maken nengi qanan.
datebos nipaloman na baqi to pelolo, maken nengi qanan.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: melizaq iku menanum tu ucia ni baqi, nengi nanuman.
melizaq iko menanom to ocia ni baqi, nengi nanoman.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: tutu ti nani, masulun iku tu bai ku meRamaz tu satutuan.
toto ti nani, masolon iko to bai ko meRamaz to satotoan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: muwaza niRamazan na ni bai tu satutuan, yau baut, yau taquq, yau salu seRay luli.
mowaza niRamazan na ni bai to satotoan, yao baot, yao taqoq, yao salo seRay loli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: pun ti qeman satutu, matiw imi sa bawbi qaytenned.
pon ti qeman satoto, matiw imi sa bawbi qaytenned.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: mala ti ti bai tu muwaza qawpiR, sebata seRay dukiyu bula timaikuan, sapatananan ku.
mala ti ti bai to mowaza qawpiR, sebata seRay dokiyo bola timaikoan, sapatananan ko.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: qawi ti iku zin ku ta qaniauan, sanuan ku tu qawtuan muman temayta ta qaniauan.
qawi ti iko zin ko ta qaniaoan, sanoan ko to qawtoan moman temayta ta qaniaoan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: azasan na imi na patudan matiw sa tunguyen setangi, yau imi paylit ta ngayawan na tanganan meRasa tu paya.
azasan na imi na patodan matiw sa tongoyen setangi, yao imi paylit ta ngayawan na tanganan meRasa to paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: semuRem ti ta tunguyenan, semanu ti patudan," ta ngayawan nani adam. ta tuRuzan nani, siqqay. aimu ti temaytayta."
semoRem ti ta tongoyenan, semano ti patodan," ta ngayawan nani adam. ta toRozan nani, siqqay. aimo ti temaytayta."
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: maytis iku tu siqqay, Raqana taqa iku tayta tu siqqay.
maytis iko to siqqay, Raqana taqa iko tayta to siqqay.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: meqayta ti iku tu muwaza adam temanbaseR ta paRinan, yau pama kuu ta ngaqatan na paRin maynep.
meqayta ti iko to mowaza adam temanbaseR ta paRinan, yao pama koo ta ngaqatan na paRin maynep.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ta tunguyenan yau zu', kebayu seRay luqenaw, mai pama iku tumayta tu nazau ay pasan. meqayta ti nani, maken melizaq iku setangi.
ta tongoyenan yao zo', kebayo seRay loqenaw, mai pama iko tomayta to nazao ay pasan. meqayta ti nani, maken melizaq iko setangi.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: yau muwaza nipaninguan ku, sapataytan ku tu tama seRay tina ku.
yao mowaza nipaningoan ko, sapataytan ko to tama seRay tina ko.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: antemawaR qasulun pa iku tu tama, tina ku mawtu.
antemawaR qasolon pa iko to tama, tina ko mawto.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: setangi qaRabian, tanan pa ti suani ku.
setangi qaRabian, tanan pa ti soani ko.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: matiw iku seRay bai ku sa sitiung meRasa tu taquq, pasaya meRamaz tu nengi qanan ay saRabian paqan tu suani ku.
matiw iko seRay bai ko sa sitiong meRasa to taqoq, pasaya meRamaz to nengi qanan ay saRabian paqan to soani ko.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: melaziw ti imi tu tiyam baliw tu tenned, yau muwaza tasu ay tenned ta tiyaman.
melaziw ti imi to tiyam baliw to tenned, yao mowaza taso ay tenned ta tiyaman.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，店裡有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: meRasa ti imi tu ingsay, beRasuk seRay tebaRi ay saytaw.
meRasa ti imi to ingsay, beRasok seRay tebaRi ay saytaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: ta kinilan ay, baliw tu suykuo ay tawki semanu, "datebus unglay seRay lupas ku, Rasa ka tu qakiya!"
ta kinilan ay, baliw to soykoo ay tawki semano, "datebos onglay seRay lopas ko, Rasa ka to qakiya!"
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: meRasa ti imi tu unglay seRay lupas.
meRasa ti imi to onglay seRay lopas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: melaziw ti imi tu tiyam baliw tu 'si, semanu ya tawki, "niana ngidan su Rasa? setangi ay taquq nizu Raya, misi, ussiq taquq utulu Rasibu asa na."
melaziw ti imi to tiyam baliw to 'si, semano ya tawki, "niana ngidan so Rasa? setangi ay taqoq nizo Raya, misi, ossiq taqoq otolo Rasibo asa na."
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: "siRis dames." zin na bai ku, ipilan na tawki qanengi saizan tu kiya ni?
"siRis dames." zin na bai ko, ipilan na tawki qanengi saizan to kiya ni?
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點?
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: wanayka," mesaiz ti, Rayngu ti qasaizan." zin na tawki semanu.
wanayka," mesaiz ti, Rayngo ti qasaizan." zin na tawki semano.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: semanu ti ya ta kinilan ay tawki," qawtu ka Rasa tu baut ku, Raya, saiz baut ku."
semano ti ya ta kinilan ay tawki," qawto ka Rasa to baot ko, Raya, saiz baot ko."
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Raylikuz meRasa ti imi tu taquq, meRasa ti tu baut qaya. temanan ti ta leppawan, meRamaz ti tu satakanan tamun.
Raylikoz meRasa ti imi to taqoq, meRasa ti to baot qaya. temanan ti ta leppawan, meRamaz ti to satakanan tamon.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: tennes ti melana, tedem ti deddan.
tennes ti melana, tedem ti deddan.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: yau ti dingwa na suani ku, pammeng sukaw pahibang ta hitayan, antemawaR ti lipayan qawka qanengi tanan.
yao ti dingwa na soani ko, pammeng sokaw pahibang ta hitayan, antemawaR ti lipayan qawka qanengi tanan.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: semanu ti ti bai," muwaza niRamazan ku, tingaR ika mazemun mawtu qeman."
semano ti ti bai," mowaza niRamazan ko, tingaR ika mazemon mawto qeman."
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: tingaRan niaq ti qenasuani, mawtu masulun qeman saRabi.
tingaRan niaq ti qenasoani, mawto masolon qeman saRabi.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: yau paqenanem kaput ku ti utay. pataz kalingun mazas tu Ribang.
yao paqenanem kapot ko ti otay. pataz kalingon mazas to Ribang.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫utay，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named utay, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: temaqsi ti nani, meliway aizipna ta kaputan tu bilu, sasupasan uu sasudadan.
temaqsi ti nani, meliway aizipna ta kapotan to bilo, sasopasan oo sasodadan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: qakelisa, siqazusa, siqatulu, qawman paliway aimi meniz timaizipana.
qakelisa, siqazosa, siqatolo, qawman paliway aimi meniz timaizipana.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: wanayka sukaw waway na, pataz meliway tu Ribang nani, mai patadikud.
wanayka sokaw waway na, pataz meliway to Ribang nani, mai patadikod.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Raylikuz taqa ti imi paliway timaizipana.
Raylikoz taqa ti imi paliway timaizipana.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: yau ussiq deddan, masulun imi semaqsaqay.
yao ossiq deddan, masolon imi semaqsaqay.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ta lazanan, ngid siabaRat ti utay, wanayka mekalingun ti mazas tu sakedisan.
ta lazanan, ngid siabaRat ti otay, wanayka mekalingon ti mazas to sakedisan.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，utay想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, utay wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: ngid liway tu sakedisan, sumkil imi meniz timaizipana semanu," mai iku mazas qaya."
ngid liway to sakedisan, somkil imi meniz timaizipana semano," mai iko mazas qaya."
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: muRing ti ti utay, qumnut ti semanu timaimian," manna taqa imu paliway tu sakedisan timaikuan!"
moRing ti ti otay, qomnot ti semano timaimian," manna taqa imo paliway to sakedisan timaikoan!"
S.TRANSL: utay急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
utay burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: semanu ti kaput timaizipana," nayau pataz isu mai mazas tu Ribang, maduna mai patadikud tu niliwayan su!"
semano ti kapot timaizipana," nayao pataz iso mai mazas to Ribang, madona mai patadikod to niliwayan so!"
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: temawaR na, semuRap ti ti utay maseq ta taqsian, patadikudan na ti niliwayan na tu Ribang ta kaputan na.
temawaR na, semoRap ti ti otay maseq ta taqsian, patadikodan na ti niliwayan na to Ribang ta kapotan na.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，utay很早就到學校了，utay把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, utay arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: semubat ti ti utay tu kaput na semanu," qusazui si, suppaR ti iku mazas tu Ribang ku." muwanay tu kaput na paliway timaizipana tu Ribang.
semobat ti ti otay to kapot na semano," qosazoi si, soppaR ti iko mazas to Ribang ko." mowanay to kapot na paliway timaizipana to Ribang.
S.TRANSL: utay向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
utay apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: pasalawan tama ku ta damuan.
pasalawan tama ko ta damoan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: sunis pama iku nani, Rabi ti, mazas tu saRiq seRay pissa melusit ya tama seRay baqi.
sonis pama iko nani, Rabi ti, mazas to saRiq seRay pissa melosit ya tama seRay baqi.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: teRi ti nani, mazas ti tu nisalawan temanan.
teRi ti nani, mazas ti to nisalawan temanan.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: yau zuma babuy na naung, yau zuma lawal, yau zuma tiquRis.
yao zoma baboy na naong, yao zoma lawal, yao zoma tiqoRis.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有竹雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: sinapunan na ti na qaniyau nisalawan ta suReman na damu, bula tu Raqit.
sinaponan na ti na qaniyao nisalawan ta soReman na damo, bola to Raqit.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: pataz iku meRusiR tu tama, ngid qasulun matiw semalaw.
pataz iko meRosiR to tama, ngid qasolon matiw semalaw.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: "Raya ti iku nani, qawka mazas timaikuan matiw." zin na ni tama.
"Raya ti iko nani, qawka mazas timaikoan matiw." zin na ni tama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: suppaR patikas qemapaR tu pasan Runanay na damu, semangi qaniyau tu tiwa tikas seRay pemattu ay tikas.
soppaR patikas qemapaR to pasan Ronanay na damo, semangi qaniyao to tiwa tikas seRay pematto ay tikas.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: mesuppaR tama ku semangi tu tiwa tikas, sikawma tama ku," saqapaRan tu tiquRis zau, paqangi ita temita tu qenazepanan na pasan, sepawan ta tikas ta wakadan."
mesoppaR tama ko semangi to tiwa tikas, sikawma tama ko," saqapaRan to tiqoRis zao, paqangi ita temita to qenazepanan na pasan, sepawan ta tikas ta wakadan."
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓竹雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ngid iku qalazuk masulun tu Raqit matiw semalaw, pitemawaR iku sinanam semangi tu tikas. mai tennes, qanengi pa ti maken mala tu pasan tikas ku.
ngid iko qalazok masolon to Raqit matiw semalaw, pitemawaR iko sinanam semangi to tikas. mai tennes, qanengi pa ti maken mala to pasan tikas ko.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: meqayta ti tama nani, sikawma timaiku," qusazui nani, qasatuRin ay pasalawan aisu."
meqayta ti tama nani, sikawma timaiko," qosazoi nani, qasatoRin ay pasalawan aiso."
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: setangi, Raya ti iku, kemaway iku tu pani ku, masulun tu tama matiw semalaw.
setangi, Raya ti iko, kemaway iko to pani ko, masolon to tama matiw semalaw.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: temanan ti ta damuan nani, sinapun tu Raqit tu nisalawan niaq.
temanan ti ta damoan nani, sinapon to Raqit to nisalawan niaq.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: semanu tama ku," muwanay ita tu baqbaqi, baibai ta, bula timaitan tu muwaza nialan ta."
semano tama ko," mowanay ita to baqbaqi, baibai ta, bola timaitan to mowaza nialan ta."
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: tangzasan ti iku temaqsi taRbabi.
tangzasan ti iko temaqsi taRbabi.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: matiw iku sa taqsian nani, mekalingun ti iku mazas tu lubus na taqsian.
matiw iko sa taqsian nani, mekalingon ti iko mazas to lobos na taqsian.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: mai iku mazas tu Ribang ku.
mai iko mazas to Ribang ko.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有帶到我的東西。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: temaqsi nani, masulun iku tu kaput ku temayta tu sudad.
temaqsi nani, masolon iko to kapot ko temayta to sodad.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: sumking nani, paliway kaput ku timaiku tu bilu seRay sasupasan.
somking nani, paliway kapot ko timaiko to bilo seRay sasopasan.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: semanu patudan timaiku, "kalamaz ka qasuwat! naRin ti tangzasan uman!"
semano patodan timaiko, "kalamaz ka qasowat! naRin ti tangzasan oman!"
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床！不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: sanengi ay kaput ku nani, ti utay nangan na, kebalan qaya aizipna.
sanengi ay kapot ko nani, ti otay nangan na, kebalan qaya aizipna.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫utay，他也是噶瑪蘭族。
My good friend’s name is utay, and he is also an kebalan child.

S.FORM: masulun imi temaqsi ta damuan tasiamsiw.
masolon imi temaqsi ta damoan tasiamsiw.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在大峰峰部落讀書。
We study together in the Tasiamsiw tribe.

S.FORM: pataz imi masulun mipil tu baqi pakungku timaimian, niz imi mesuppaR temankebalan.
pataz imi masolon mipil to baqi pakongko timaimian, niz imi mesoppaR temankebalan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說噶瑪蘭語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the kebalan proficiently.

S.FORM: ibabaw, missi iku, ilibeng, qiwat ti utay.
ibabaw, missi iko, ilibeng, qiwat ti otay.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，utay很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while utay is short and thin.

S.FORM: medaduna ti utay, qalizaqan na meniz.
medadona ti otay, qalizaqan na meniz.
S.TRANSL: utay很有勤勞，大家都很喜歡他。
utay is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: undukay na taqsian deddan tangi, muwaza nipasayan na taqsian tu simsuqasan.
ondokay na taqsian deddan tangi, mowaza nipasayan na taqsian to simsoqasan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: azu ti simtebes tu Rais, semippiq tu mali, manubi, salekiaw, pemani.
azo ti simtebes to Rais, semippiq to mali, manobi, salekiaw, pemani.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: melabu iku tu simsuqasan manubi.
melabo iko to simsoqasan manobi.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: meRaRiw iku nani, mesuRaw ti iku, meRinang ti tusuz ku.
meRaRiw iko nani, mesoRaw ti iko, meRinang ti tosoz ko.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流血了。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: wanayka masengat ti iku muman meRaRiw.
wanayka masengat ti iko moman meRaRiw.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: maseq ti iku ta qaseqan nani, melilizaq ti meniz.
maseq ti iko ta qaseqan nani, melilizaq ti meniz.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: mai iku mala tu saqaussiq sayzi, wanayka mulepun iku tu simsuqasan zau, Raqana melizaq iku.
mai iko mala to saqaossiq sayzi, wanayka molepon iko to simsoqasan zao, Raqana melizaq iko.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我完成了比賽，所以我很高興。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: siRab masulun iku tu tama ku matiw melaut tu baqi ku ti angawan.
siRab masolon iko to tama ko matiw melaot to baqi ko ti angawan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔angaw。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: meluzit ti zapan na ni baqi angaw.
melozit ti zapan na ni baqi angaw.
S.TRANSL: angaw叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: semanu aizipna timaimi, satangan senizasan na leppaw na.
semano aizipna timaimi, satangan senizasan na leppaw na.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: yau paqangi tu senizasan aizipna nani, temibuq ti nizi ta senizasan.
yao paqangi to senizasan aizipna nani, temiboq ti nizi ta senizasan.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: mazas tama ku tu 'si na qabaw seRay dadas bula tu baqi.
mazas tama ko to 'si na qabaw seRay dadas bola to baqi.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: sidadak imi aiku seRay baqi ku ti angaw ta qinpanan, muwaza nipakungku na.
sidadak imi aiko seRay baqi ko ti angaw ta qinpanan, mowaza nipakongko na.
S.TRANSL: 我和angaw叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: qitu iku matanaq nani, muRebu ti baqi angaw semanu timaiku, "ibabaw ti isu, melabulil ti qaya."
qito iko matanaq nani, moRebo ti baqi angaw semano timaiko, "ibabaw ti iso, melabolil ti qaya."
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，angaw叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: semanu iku timaizipana, "baqi, anu nengi ti zapan su si, qawtu ka sa leppaw niaq yu!"
semano iko timaizipana, "baqi, ano nengi ti zapan so si, qawto ka sa leppaw niaq yo!"
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: ta uzusa lalazan uzusa betin yau uzusa tasaw, pasaya ti sihu tu huygi simsanu qanengi wan ma semudad tu qeluqut na yencumincu semudad tu nangan ta mibunsiwan na yencumin.
ta ozosa lalazan ozosa betin yao ozosa tasaw, pasaya ti siho to hoygi simsano qanengi wan ma semodad to qeloqot na yencominco semodad to nangan ta mibonsiwan na yencomin.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: pasanu iku tu malemes ay semuzuq temunuR tu sihu qanengi "wan ma semudad tu nangan na yencumin" ta mibunsiwan, sining na damu ti angaw ateng.
pasano iko to malemes ay semozoq temonoR to siho qanengi "wan ma semodad to nangan na yencomin" ta mibonsiwan, sining na damo ti angaw ateng.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年angaw ateng。
I interviewed angaw ateng, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: semiqet iku timaizipana ta hibangan na lipay zau qatiw sa leppaw na laut pasanu timaizipana.
semiqet iko timaizipana ta hibangan na lipay zao qatiw sa leppaw na laot pasano timaizipana.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ta pasanuan zau nani, paqesuppaR aizipna timaiku manna sinangan aizipna tu nangan zau, pasimqananam timaiku tu pinileppaw na seRay damu na.
ta pasanoan zao nani, paqesoppaR aizipna timaiko manna sinangan aizipna to nangan zao, pasimqananam timaiko to pinileppaw na seRay damo na.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: mipil iku timaizipana, "manna ngid isu uman tu nangan, masang ay waway temuki tu nangan, sukaw ni?
mipil iko timaizipana, "manna ngid iso oman to nangan, masang ay waway temoki to nangan, sokaw ni?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: semanu aizipna timaiku, anu izan na qeluqut na hulam semudad tu nangan na, maspalaki ti, yauzuma yau qaya 'daq qumRas timaizipana tu "阿先生", paqetawan.
semano aizipna timaiko, ano izan na qeloqot na holam semodad to nangan na, maspalaki ti, yaozoma yao qaya 'daq qomRas timaizipana to "阿先生", paqetawan.
S.TRANSL: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「阿先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him “Aa Xian Sheng,” which resulted in many jokes being made.

S.FORM: semanu ti angaw ateng, "izan ta zata ay qeluqut qawka maken ay nangan ta. nangan ku nani, yau waway na lazatan niaq, leppaw niaq, tungus niaq tu lazatan, ngid qazemun pa Raqit ta patadikud tu nangan na."

semano ti angaw ateng, "izan ta zata ay qeloqot qawka maken ay nangan ta. nangan ko nani, yao waway na lazatan niaq, leppaw niaq, tongos niaq to lazatan, ngid qazemon pa Raqit ta patadikod to nangan na."
S.TRANSL: angaw ateng說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

angaw ateng said, “The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group, our family, our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.”

S.FORM: siRab masulun iku tu bai ku matiw sa qizuanan baliw, temiyam baliw. muwaza niazasan na bai ku tu nipaluman na tu tened, meRamaz tu qaqanan na yencumin paqan tu semaqsaqay ay.
siRab masolon iko to bai ko matiw sa qizoanan baliw, temiyam baliw. mowaza niazasan na bai ko to nipaloman na to tened, meRamaz to qaqanan na yencomin paqan to semaqsaqay ay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: mazemun ay melizaq tu tiyam na bai ku, mazemun meRasa tu sidi' seRay kakulut, mazemun qaya temadam tu niRamazan na.
mazemon ay melizaq to tiyam na bai ko, mazemon meRasa to sidi' seRay kakolot, mazemon qaya temadam to niRamazan na.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: nengi qanan niRamazan na tu tusuzan, senapuwaR seRay nitim ay 'si na babuy na naung Ramesan tu tani, paqawtu tu mazemun semaqsaqay ay bangsis na, niz ti mawtu paylit melana ta tiyaman niaq.
nengi qanan niRamazan na to tosozan, senapowaR seRay nitim ay 'si na baboy na naong Ramesan to tani, paqawto to mazemon semaqsaqay ay bangsis na, niz ti mawto paylit melana ta tiyaman niaq.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的長埂滿天星和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的刺蔥滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

The Sessile Alternanthera and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: yau meRamaz bai ku nani, yau iku qumRas paqawtu tu semaqsaqay ay. baluduq iku ta kinilan, "tened zau nizu nipaluman niaq, mai puiyu ay, qalazuk ka qawtu Rasa yu!"
yao meRamaz bai ko nani, yao iko qomRas paqawto to semaqsaqay ay. balodoq iko ta kinilan, "tened zao nizo nipaloman niaq, mai poiyo ay, qalazok ka qawto Rasa yo!"
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, “The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!”

S.FORM: kikiya ma maniz ti baliw Ribang niaq, semanu bai ku, "yau nipanmuan su qawka."
kikiya ma maniz ti baliw Ribang niaq, semano bai ko, "yao nipanmoan so qawka."
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: ta wawayan zau, muwaza nisinanam ku tu qenasuppaRan tu tened seRay qaqanan na yencumin, suppaRan ku ti pilay temiyam baliw tu Ribang.
ta wawayan zao, mowaza nisinanam ko to qenasoppaRan to tened seRay qaqanan na yencomin, soppaRan ko ti pilay temiyam baliw to Ribang.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: nitaytan ku tu waway na bai ku melizaq tu qaqanan na lazatan niaq, muRebu iku timaizipana.
nitaytan ko to waway na bai ko melizaq to qaqanan na lazatan niaq, moRebo iko timaizipana.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
